wiki.content:
"It's the End of the World as We Know It (And I Feel Fine)" is a song by the rock band R.E.M., found on their 1987 album Document and the 1988 compilation Eponymous. It was also released as a single in 1988, reaching #69 US Billboard Hot 100 and later reaching #39 in the UK singles chart on its re-release in 1991.
 
 The song originated from a previous, unreleased, R.E.M. song called "PSA", which is short for "Public Service Announcement". The two songs are very similar in melody and tempo. "PSA" was itself later released as a single in 2003, under the title "Bad Day". In an interview with Guitar World magazine in the early 1990s, R.E.M. guitarist Peter Buck indicated that one of the primary inspirations of "End of the World" was Bob Dylan's "Subterranean Homesick Blues".
 
 The music video was directed by James Herbert, who worked with the band on several other videos in the late 1980s. It depicts a young skateboarder (Noah Ray) rifling through an abandoned, collapsing farmhouse and displaying the relics that he finds to the camera.
 
 One of REM's best songs. Featured on the Disney film Chicken Little, and in the Sony motion picture Independence Day. 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "It's the End of the World as We Know It (And I Feel Fine)" is a song by the rock band R.E.M., found on their 1987 album Document and the 1988 compilation Eponymous. It was also released as a single in 1988, reaching #69 US Billboard Hot 100 and later reaching #39 in the UK singles chart on its re-release in 1991.  The song originated from a previous, unreleased, R.E.M. song called "PSA", which is short for "Public Service Announcement". The two songs are very similar in melody and tempo. "PSA" was itself later released as a single in 2003, under the title "Bad Day".

track.name: It's the End of the World as We Know It (And I Feel Fine)
comments: Why is this song so damn catchy?!!
Timeless classic!
One of the best bands in the world....ever! It felt like the end of the world when they split. Seen them live and they even better, if thats possible?! We need more R.E.M. [2]

One of the best bands in the world....ever!
It felt like the end of the world when they split.
Seen them live and they even better, if thats possible?! 
We need more R.E.M.
creepinmaster: I'm a native English speaker and I find it difficult to sing along to this song, mainly because the verses are so fast.
This song played on every radio station you could think of on 12/21/12.
yes i do feel the same way
creepinmaster, that's exactly what I wanted to ask, the chorus is my favourite part)
this song is so difficult to sing along I kind of wonder if native English speakers feel the same
I hope the real apocalypse is this catchy. [3]
if ever the 80's move  to the present...
some songs mean everything everday
Great song =)
I hope the real apocalypse is this catchy. [2]
haha~good1, dragonswings
I hope the real apocalypse is this catchy.
Well, I have this track on repeat regardless of the date.. awesomely catchy!
It's not the end yet but.......
It's not the End of the World as We Know It, yet (And I Feel Fine). :)
probably the most played song today
